item.title: Ben add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "On a long enough time line, the survival rate for everyone drops to zero." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Ben add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Law is the ultimate science." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Ben add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Truth suffers from too much analysis." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ernest Cline
item.description: "The rest of the trailer reeked of cat piss and abject poverty." -- Ernest Cline

item.title: Ben add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "History admits no rules; only outcomes." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Ben add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "one fine day, a purely predatory world shall consume itself. Yes, the Devil shall take the hindmost until the foremost is the hindmost. In an individual, selfishness uglifies the soul; for the human species, selfishness is extinction" -- David Mitchell

item.title: Ben add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And, as with all retold tales that are in people's hearts, there are only good and bad things and black and white things and good and evil things and no in between anywhere." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ben add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "They had spoken once, but there is not need for speech if it is only a habit anyay. Kino sighed with satisfaction -- and that was conversation." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philipp Meyer
item.description: "Unlike the white, billions of whom shared the same handful of names, all interchangeable in the end, a Comanche name lived and died with a single person." -- Philipp Meyer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philipp Meyer
item.description: "but I rarely did anything I didn't feel like doing, and maybe this was the main difference between the whites and the Comanches, which was the whites were willing to trade all their freedom to live longer and eat better, and the Comanches were not willing to trade any of it." -- Philipp Meyer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philipp Meyer
item.description: "The blood that ran through history would fill every river and ocean, but despite all the butchery, here you were." -- Philipp Meyer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philipp Meyer
item.description: "It had become clear to me that the lives of the rich and famous were not so differ from the lies of the Comanches: you did what you pleased and answered to no one." -- Philipp Meyer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philipp Meyer
item.description: "Perhaps another great ice will come and grind all this into dust. Leaving no trace of our existence, as even fire does." -- Philipp Meyer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philipp Meyer
item.description: "I had never known there were so many people on earth." -- Philipp Meyer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "He finished shaving by touch, still walking around the room, for he tried to see himself in the mirror as little as possible so he would not have to look into his own eyes." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "I'm at the mercy of a destiny that isn't mine." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "And there's nothing more dangerous than a written memoir." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Someone had told the General that when a dog died it had to be replaced without delay by another just like it, and with the same name, so you could go on believing it was the same animal. He did not agree. He always wanted them to be distinctive so he could remember them all with their own identities, their yearning eyes and eager spirits, and could mourn their deaths." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "The only wars here will be civil wars, and those are like killing your own mother." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Something that concerned the officers of the entourage, which they hid from the General in order not to complete his mortification, was that the hussars and grenadiers of the guard were sowing the fiery seed of an immortal gonorrhea." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Let me be, he said. Despair is the health of the damned." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Other doctors lose as many patients as I do, he would say. But with me they die happier." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Don't stay with Urdanetea, he told him. And don't go with your family to the United States. It's omnipotent and terrible, and its tale of liberty will end in a plague of miseries for us all." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "[F]or fate granted him the immense good fortune of losing his memory." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "My soul seemed as foul as smoke from burning cat fur." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "You're wise to be cautious. People taking the last rites have a way of dying on cue." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity, the way I understand it," he told me, is knowing what your limitations are." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Science is magic that works." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "I understood this man was a Saint," he said. "Something even rarer," said Dr. Urbino, "An atheistic saint. But those are matters for God to decide." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Ben add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Dr. Urbino, prepared for a confidential visit, realized too late that there was no innocence more dangerous than the innocence of age." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
